title: Mod-09 Lec-42 GIS in Sustainable Agriculture

subtasks: Describe agriculture as the oldest profession and its historical water use
Explain the shift towards using pesticides and chemicals in agriculture
Analyze the impact of intensive farming on soil aeration and crop cycles
Discuss the role of cash crops and financial risks in agriculture
Evaluate the threats posed by climate change to agriculture
Document agricultural practices using Geographic Information Systems (GIS)
Define sustainable agriculture and its importance for future food security
Address the integration of various parameters (spatial, temporal, local) in sustainable farming
Identify unplanned agricultural practices and their impact on natural resources
Discuss the concept of smart agriculture and maximizing output with minimal input
Explain the role of remote sensing in crop area assessment and yield prediction
Describe water resource management in agriculture, emphasizing minimal losses per drop
Monitor and control pest infestations through identification and targeted interventions
Conduct land suitability analysis for optimal crop selection
Implement disaster management strategies for agriculture (e.g., drought, flooding)
Explore precision agriculture and its cost considerations
Address land degradation issues like soil salinity and waterlogging
Estimate crop yields and identify underperforming areas for improvement
Investigate environmental pollution from agricultural runoff and groundwater contamination
Enhance health and natural hazard awareness in agriculture
Acknowledge the importance of regional water availability in sustainable agriculture
Plan for climate change adaptation in agricultural practices
Set targets for increasing crop yield and ensuring food security for future generations
